title: The Black Douglas
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: Both Sholto and Laurence wereexceedingly loath to take the former course. They had not, however,long to hesitate, for a train of sumpter mules, belonging to the LordHerries of Terregles, whose father had been with Archibald the Tinemanin France, came up laden with the choicest products of the bordercountry which he designed to offer as part of the "Service-Kane" tohis overlord, the Earl of Douglas.

title: The Black Douglas
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: Both Sholto and Laurence wereexceedingly loath to take the former course. They had not, however,long to hesitate, for a train of sumpter mules, belonging to the LordHerries of Terregles, whose father had been with Archibald the Tinemanin France, came up laden with the choicest products of the bordercountry which he designed to offer as part of the "Service-Kane" tohis overlord, the Earl of Douglas.

title: Cleg Kelly, arab of the city,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: " Ye are a nice cunning wratch to be an elder — you and Mirren Terregles baith — and at your time o' life. An' hoo is she ? "

title: Cleg Kelly, arab of the city,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: " D'ye think that because I hae to put up wi' a great hulk like you, comin' hame at nicht smellin' o' cinders and lamp oil, that I'm gaun to leeve in a hut amang the coal waggons ? Na, certes, gin ye want to hae Mirren ' Terregles to keep ye snug, ye maun e'en walk a mile or twa extra in the day. And it will be the better for keepin'  doon that great muckle corporation o' yours ! "

title: The Black Douglas ... Second impression.
author: Crockett, Samuel Rutherford.
snippet: BothSholto and Laurence were exceedingly loath to take theformer course. They had not, however, long to hesitate,for a train of sumpter mules, belonging to the Lord Herries of Terregles, whose father had been with Archibaldthe Tineman in France, came up laden with the choicestproducts of the border country which he designed to offeras part of the " Service-Kane " to his overlord, the Earlof Douglas.

title: Cleg Kelly, Arab of the City
author: Crockett, Samuel Rutherford.
